question: Many governments think that economic progress is their most important goal. Some people, however, think that other type of progress are equally important for a country. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
text: Nowadays, the financial development of a country has been altered to be a significant factor in a society's prosperity. Yet, there remains a controversial debate as to whether this criterion is the most prominent reason in the improvement of a community or other phenomena that can be introduced to have the same importance. This essay will discuss this topic from both sides of view with some detailed explanations.

Firstly, higher income for a region can improve the living standards for the inhabitants of that area. This is an indisputable fact that people's happiness is directly related to the amount of salary they can earn. As a salient example, wealth can satisfy most of the vital needs for a family ,which can considerably increase their life expectancy;  also, this can result in  higher motivation and initiative for an individual to use his potential in increasing the overall efficiency that is able to contribute higher revenue for the company or the government. Consequently, providing higher financial supports in the social fabric can lead to reaching valuable porpuses in the agrarian.

On the other hand, other kinds of progress can play  vital roles in assisting  society in developing faster. Moreover, other various kinds of options can enhance the progress of a union such as academic, medical and industrial processes. Considering the fact that the educational system is the primary core of a nation to raise the pupils with appropriate ethical codes, it can be crucial for the future improvement of a region, which can not be replaced with an additional alternative; medical development of a country is another  fundamental procedure for the health of a nation  that must be maintained as well. Despite the importance of the economic enhancement of a nation, other factors can be influential for the future progress of a nation.

As a way of conclusion, I once again reaffirm that many considerable matters are capable of guiding a country through the road of success; however, I strongly believe that economic growth is not the main part of this success ,while there is the more noticeable matrix for this process. Furthermore, there must be a balance between the importance of all effective criteria for the advancement of a country.
